title: Recipes
text:
Preface
These are the recipes I like to use.
Key:
 Vegan
 Freezable
 Family recipe

title: 1  Bread
text: 1.1 Basic Bread

title: 1  Bread
text:
500g bread flour
1/2tsp salt
1tsp yeast
1tsp sugar
1tbsp oil
325ml warm water





220C

loaf

title: 1  Bread
text:
1.2 Focaccia  




500g bread flour
7g yeast
2 + 1.5 + 1 tbsp olive oil
salt
rosemary
350-400ml water





200C
25 mins
25x35”


Method


- Knead 5-10mins.
- Prove 1hr.
- Stretch to fit tin.
- Prove 45m.
- Dimple, add rosemary, drizzle with oil, 1tbsp water, salt.
- Bake.
- Drizzle with oil while hot.


Notes


- Half mix fits in 20cm square.


https://www.bbcgoodfood.com/recipes/focaccia

title: 1  Bread
text:
1.3 Fruit And Nut Rolls  




150g wholemeal bread flour
150g P flour
1tsp salt
1tsp yeast
1tsp brown sugar
1tsp oil
110g nuts
100g fruit





200C
15-20 mins
8


Method


- Combine flour, salt and yeast.
- Mix 200ml hot water with sugar and oil.
- For dough and knead 5 mins.
- Press into 30cm square, scatter fruit and nuts, roll, cut, shape.
- Prove 1h 15m then bake.


https://www.deliaonline.com/recipes/type-of-dish/bread-recipes/walnut-and-raisin-bread

title: 1  Bread
text:
1.4 Garlic Doughballs  




50g butter
300g white bread flour
7g yeast
1tbsp sugar
1tsp salt

Topping:
100g butter
1 garlic clove





160C
25-30 mins
30


Method


- Add butter to 175ml warm water first.
- Knead 5mins until bouncy and smooth.
- Prove 1.5-2 hours.
- Knock back and knead for several minutes.
- Roll into balls about 0.5cm apart.
- Prove 30mins.
- Bake then brush some of the butter and leave cool for 5 mins.


https://www.bbcgoodfood.com/recipes/dough-balls-garlic-butter

title: 1  Bread
text:
1.5 Pizza Dough 




1/2 tsp yeast
150ml warm water
1/4 tsp sugar
220g P flour
3/2 tbsp extra virgin olive oil
1/3 tsp salt
semolina








Method


- Bloom yeast, water and sugar for 10mins -> bubble.
- Combine until shaggy dough.
- Knead 10-15min.
- Prove.
- Semolina under dough on baking tray.

title: 1  Bread
text:
1.6 Rolls  




500g bread flour
340ml water
4g yeast
8g salt
6g sugar





200C
16-18 mins
10


Method


- Bloom yeast.
- Gradually add dry.
- Knead 10mins.
- Turn and prove 1hr.
- Turn and prove 30mins.
- Roll balls and rest 5 mins.
- Shape into ovals.
- Prove 20mins.
- Bake.


Notes


- Add steam to oven.


https://profoodhomemade.com/crusty-bread-rolls/

title: 1  Bread
text:
1.7 Yeast-Raised No-Knead Flatbread 




500g P flour
7g yeast
360ml water
1tbsp oilve oil
1tbsp sugar
1tsp salt





12


Method


- Bloom yeast with olive oil.
- Add wet to try and mix with spoon.
- Prove 30-60mins.
- Make balls then roll into flatbreads.
- Cook on skillet for 30 seconds (bubbles form on top.
- Flip and cook for another 30 seconds.


Notes


- Soft, tasty, good for gyros/falafels.
- Kept and reheated well.


https://veenaazmanov.com/no-knead-flatbread-recipe/

title: 2  Biscuits
text:
2.1 Bourbons
Method
- Cream sugar and butter.
- Stir in dry and mix to dough.
- Chill 30mins.
- Roll to 0.5cm thick, cut, prick, bake. For filling:
- Cream sugar and butter first.
Notes
- "Like a bourbon, but good!"
- Freezing changes the texture.
https://wallflowerkitchen.com/vegan-bourbon-biscuits

vanilla

Notes

- 15 x 39g balls for a bake sale.

200g caster sugar

20

Notes

title: 2  Biscuits
text:
2.8 Double Chocolate Cookies  




110g margarine
100g caster sugar
100g light brown sugar
1tsp vanilla
125g P flour
55g cocoa
1tsp BP
pinch salt
1tbsp milk

10 mins
20


Method

- Optional to top with chips.


Notes


- Chewy, soft.
- Nice with 50-50 hazelnuts;chocolate chips.
- 15-16 x 40g balls for a bake sale.

title: 2  Biscuits
text:
2.9 Double Chocolate Cookies




125g butter
175g light brown sugar
1 egg
175g SR flour
50g cocoa
100g chocolate chips





170C
12-15 mins
25


Method


- Cream until light and fluffy.
- Beat in eggs.
- Fold rest.
- Roll, chill, bake.


Notes


- Chewy and crisp.
- Nice with hazelnuts too.

title: 2  Biscuits
text:
2.10 Gingerbread  




125g (4.5oz) marg
100g(3.5oz) dark brown sugar
4tbsp syrup
325g (11.5oz) P flour
1tsp B of S
2tsp ginger
1tsp cinnamon





170C
9-10m mins
17 x trees


Method


- Melt marg, sugar, syrup.
- Stir to a stiff dough.
- Roll, cut, chill, bake.


Notes


- Can bake dough from frozen, add couple more minutes.

title: 2  Biscuits
text:
2.11 Hobnobs 




75g butter
75g caster sugar
1/2tbsp syrup
75g wholemeal flour
150g oats
1/2 tsp B of S





180C
10 mins
15


Method


- Beat butter and sugar.
- Mix in syrup.
- Add mixed dry to wet a bit at a time -> crumbly mix.
- Press mixture into a 6.5cm cookie cutter and compress;, Bake and spread.


Notes


- A bit too sweet, so needs that dark chocolate - could try reducing sugar?
- Used ~60g chocolate to cover.
- 2tbsp mix per biscuit.
- Like crumble mix.


https://www.bbcgoodfood.com/user/10516111/recipe/homemade-hobnobs

title: 2  Biscuits
text:
2.12 Lebkuchen  




7oz runny honey
3oz butter
7oz P flour
3.5oz ground almonds
1tsp BP
1/4tsp B of S
3/2 tsp cinnamon
3.5tsp ginger
1tsp mixed spice
(1/2tsp nutmeg/allspice/..)
1/2 zest and juice of orange
200g chocolate





180C
15 mins
18


Method


- Melt honey and butter, then cool 5 mins in fridge.
- Add remaining then chill for at least an hour.
- Roll with damp hands.
- Bake, cool, dip.


Notes


- "Like a jaffa cake".
- Used 108g chocolate to coat bottoms


https://www.bbc.co.uk/food/recipes/lebkuchen_88786

title: 2  Biscuits
text:
2.13 Lemon Sandwich Biscuits




150g butter
1 lemon zest
85g caster sugar
1 egg yolk
280g P flour
1tbsp cornflour

Filling:
75g butter
130g icing sugar
2tbsp lemon curd





180C
14-16 mins
20 x sandwiches


Method


- Cream sugar, butter, zest 2-3 mins until pale and creamy.
- Beat in egg yolk 1 min.
- Mix in flour -> clumps.
- Bring to ball, roll to 3-4mm thick, chill at least an hour.
- Cut, bake.
- Beat buttercream 3-5mins until very pale and creamy before adding lemon curd.


Notes


- Can top with simple lemon icing.

title: 2  Biscuits
text:
2.14 Nankhatai 




3 green cardamom pods
40g icing sugar
100g butter
70g SR flour
25g semolina
25g gram flour
pinch salt
almonds





140C
20 mins
24


Method


- Grind cardamom seeds with 1tsp icing sugar.
- Beat butter, sugar, cardamom until light and creamy about 10mins.
- Marble-sized balls.
- Flatten slightly with almond.
- Chill 20 mins before baking.


Notes


- Delicate flavour and light biscuit.

250g butter
50g icing sugar
225g P flour
25g cornflour
Buttercream 100g butter
200g icing sugar

Method

Notes

title: 3  Cakes
text:
3.2 Carrot Cake  




6oz marg
6oz light brown sugar
3 eggs
4oz carrot
2oz raisins
2oz dates
1/2tsp cinnamon
1/4tsp nutmeg
1oz coconut
1oz walnuts
6oz wholemeal flour
pinch salt

Notes

- Replace eggs with 7.5oz apple puree and 1/2tsp BP, but may need to cook a little longer with foil on top.

title: 3  Cakes
text:
3.3 Chocolate And Caramel Cake




47.5g cocoa
120g light brown sugar
1tsp vanilla
87.5ml just boiled water
210g P flour
1/2 tsp BP
1/2 tsp B of S
125g butter
140 sugar
2 eggs. Caramel:
150g sugar
150ml double cream
1/2 tsp vanilla
1tsp sea salt. Buttercream:
110g egg white (<3 eggs)
160g sugar
235g butter





160C
20-25 mins
2 x 8” round


Method


- Whisk cocoa, sugar, vanilla and water until smooth and leave cool 5 mins.
- Cream butter and sugar, 3-5 mins, then beat in eggs 1 at a time.
- Fold in dry 1/3 at a time, then cooled cocoa mixture.
- Bake. For caramel, sugar and 6tbsp water in saucepan over medium heat, cook 6-8 mins no stirring, until starts to turn deep amber.
- Remove from heat and place in bowl cold water.
- Slowly whisk in cream and vanilla -> thick pouring consistency (can stir over heat if necessary).
- Stir in salt and leave to cool.
- For buttercream, whisk egg whites and sugar until smooth.
- Place over pan of simmering water for 5mins, whisking occasionally until sugar dissolves - feels smooth, not grainy between fingertips.
- Whisk  about 7mins to stiff peaks.
- Add butter and whisk about 5mins, until smooth and glossy - don't panic if appears to curdle, just keep whisking.
- Add vanilla and 5 tbsp cooled caramel, 1tbsp at a time and mix until smooth.


Notes


- Not too chocolately or too sweet.
- Buttercream very smooth and silky. Could do with less buttercream.
- Caramel sauce did not work as stated - hard lumps of sugar and had to heat slowly to get mix with cream - next time would not dunk in cold water, but would add warm cream instead.


https://thegreatbritishbakeoff.co.uk/recipes/all/laura-chocolate-and-salted-caramel-cake/

title: 3  Cakes
text:
3.9 Lemon Cake 




295ml milk
10ml apple cider vinegar
120ml aquafaba
115g butter
120ml oil
300g sugar
1 tbsp lemon zest
1 tbsp lemon extract
1dsp vanilla
350g P flour
12g baking powder
3g salt
turmeric





175C
2 x 8” round


Method


- Combine milk and vinegar and sit aside for buttermilk.
- Mix aquafaba 1-2 mins high speed into light and foamy and set aside.
- Beat butter, oil, sugar and lemon zest 3 mins until light and fluffy.
- Mix in buttermilk and aquafaba.
- Fold in rest, do not overmix.


Notes


- Paired with buttercream with lemon zest.


https://www.noracooks.com/vegan-lemon-cake/

title: 4  Desserts
text:
4.1 Bakewell Tart
Method
- Shape pastry into disc and chill half an hour.
- Roll and line tart.
- Prick and freeze 20mins.
- Bake with beans 20 mins, then without 10mins until pale golden then set aside.
- Whisk melted butter and sugar, then whisk in flours.
- Gradually whik in aquafaba, then rest of frangipane.
- Assemble and bake 30-45mins.
https://domesticgothess.com/blog/2020/05/28/vegan-bakewell-tart/

title: 4  Desserts
text:
4.2 Chocolate Caramels  




100g dark brown sugar
2tbsp water
2tbsp tahini or nut butter
2tbsp coconut oil or vegan butter
1/4 tsp fine sea salt
1/2 tsp vanilla
300g dark chocolate





35


Method


- Heat sugar and water until dissolved and starting to bubble - swirl if necessary - 2-3 mins max.
- Remove from heat add oil, tahini, salt and vanilla and stir.
- Heat very low for 30 seconds if won't come together., Cool - will be very runny at first, but will thicken as cool.
- Once cool, line moulds with 3mm chocolate and leave couple of mins.
- Then fill with cool caramel and top with 2-3mm chocolate.
- After 30 mins in freezer, can demould.


Notes


- Thought the tahini was quite strong, but were liked by others. Maybe peanut butter would be nice?


https://avirtualvegan.com/vegan-chocolate-salted-caramels/#recipe

text:

- Press into time and chill for 1 hour or until set.


Notes

text:

2 x 400g cans coconut milk, chilled

45577 mins

Method


- Crush biscuits, mix in rest and enough butter to create dough.
- Press into tin, bake and cool.
- Whisk melted chocolate, syrup and only thick coconut (discard water).
- Pour over base and set in fridge for 3-4 hours.


Notes


- Kept in fridge for few days.
- Nice with raspberries.


https://www.bbcgoodfood.com/recipes/easy-chocolate-tart

title: 5  Dinners

5.1 Bean Burgers
Method

text:

8

title: 5  Dinners
text:
5.2 Falafel  




16oz dried chickpeas
1/2tsp B of S
1 small onion
1/4 cup parsley
3-5 cloves garlic
3/2 tbs gram flour
1.75 tsp salt
2tsp cumin
1tsp ground coriander
1/4tsp black pepper
1/4tsp cayenne pepper
pinch cardamom
1tsp BP
oil for frying





182-190C


Method


- Soak chickpeas in water and B of S 12-24 hours.
- Drain and rinse well.
- Food process everything until rough, coarse meal forms - between couscous and paste.
- Refrigerate 1-2 hours.
- Shape into balls - will stick together loosely at first, but will bind once begin to fry.
- If won't bind, try processor again to make more paste-like.
- If stil not, try adding flour.
- Fry 2-3 mins per side.


Notes


- 9.5oz chickpeas made enough for 5 people.
- Can freeze cooked falafel and reheat in oven from frozen, but not the same.


https://toriavey.com/falafel/

title: 5  Dinners
text:
5.3 Toad-In-Hole




70g P flour
1 egg
87.5ml milk
seasoning





200C
25-30 mins
Small glass square dish


Method


- Cook 3 sausages in oil in oven.
- Make batter and leave to stand until sausages ready.
- Pour batter into hot dish and cook until risen and golden.


Notes


- Can use oat milk.

title: 8  Pancakes and Scones
text:
8.1 Classic Scones
Method
- Mix dry.
- Rub in butter to breadcrumbs.
- Stir in sugar (and fruit).
- Warm milk about 30seconds then add vanilla and lemon and set aside for a moment.
- Heat baking tray.
- Add wet to dry well and combine quickly with knife.
- Tip onto floured surface, dredge with flour and fold over 2-3 times.
- Pat into about 4cm high, cut, glaze, bake.

title: 10  Traybakes
text:
10.8 Lemon Bars 




Base:
6oz P flour
4oz marg
2oz caster sugar

Filling:
200g caster sugar
25g P flour
pinch salt
3 eggs
3 lemon zest
200ml lemon juice (3-4 lemons)





160-180C
25-35 mins
8” square


Method


- Bake shortbread at 180 for 15-20mins.
- Whisk filling together while base is cooling, pour over and bake at 160 for 10-15 mins (until top is just set).
- Dust with icing sugar.

title: 10  Traybakes
text:
10.9 Lemon Bars 




Base:
use shortbread base from other recipe

Filling:
177ml lemon juice (about 4 large lemons)
Optional 2tsp lemon zest
300g caster sugar
296 coconut milk - mostly the thick part
6tbs cornflour
pinch turmeric





180C
15 mins
8” square


Method


- Bake base.
- Whisk filling ingredients well and heat over medium heat until sugar dissolves and mixture thickens.
- Spread over base and bake.
- Chill 1-2 hours or overnight until set.


Notes


- Nice, very lemony/tart, did not use zest


https://www.noracooks.com/vegan-lemon-bars/#wprm-recipe-container-5401

title: 10  Traybakes
text:
10.10 Peppermint Mini Rolls 




150ml aquafaba
100g caster sugar
80g P flour
2tbsp cocoa
1/2tsp BP
1/4 tsp vanilla
FIlling:
125g butter
125g icing sugar
1tsp milk
few drops peppermint extract





24 x 32 cm


Method


- Whip aquafaba to almost stiff peaks.
- Add sugar in spoonful at a time, whilst whipping to stiff.
- Add whites to dry ingredients in 2 alternating lots.
- Spread in tim and bake 5 mins at 220, then 5-10mins at 180.
- Cool 2mins, roll, then leave to cool.
- Spread filling, roll and chill 30mins.
- Coat in 180g chocolate and chill to set.


Notes


- Very tasty.
- Aquafaba whipping can take 15mins+.
- Original recipe uses 3 eggs instead.
- Reddit tips:
- https:;//www.reddit.com/r/AskBaking/comments/lzpyg8/swiss_roll_disaster_rubbery_bottom_what_did_do/


https://www.bbcgoodfood.com/recipes/chocolate-peppermint-mini-rolls

title: 10  Traybakes
text:
10.12 Twix 




Base:
300g P flour
10g caster sugar
200g butter
1tsp vanilla

Filling:
640g vegan condensed milk
270g butter
100g light brown sugar

Topping:
250g chocolate





180C
30 mins
8” square


Method


- Bake shortbread until lightly golden then leave to cool.
- Place all filling ingredients over low-medium heat until turn amber, stirring all the time - takes 15-20mins to reach firm ball stage.
- Pour over base and chill 3-4hrs until set.


Notes


- Softer and chewier than caramel shortbread - more like twix.


https://www.thelittleblogofvegan.com/2021/02/easy-vegan-twix-bars.html
